decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use Nexus of Fate, Growth Spiral, and Wilderness Reclamation to take extra turns, while utilizing cards like Fog, Dig Through Time, and Tamiyo to control the board and dig for key pieces. The deck aims to stall the game and continuously loop extra turns until it can find a win condition like Thing in the Ice or a massive Cyclonic Rift. The deck also utilizes cards like Narset and Search for Azcanta to filter through the deck and find its combo pieces efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using creatures like Llanowar Elves, Elvish Mystic, and Burning-Tree Emissary, and then use that mana to power up devotion to green with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Leyline of Abundance. This allows for powerful plays early in the game with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Walking Ballista. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and efficient removal spells while maintaining a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai to create an infinite loop that generates an army of hasty cat tokens. The deck includes support cards like Rogue Refiner, Gilded Goose, and Teferi, Time Raveler to facilitate the combo and protect it from disruption. Additional cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Heart of Kiran provide versatility and additional threats to pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the mana requirements of the combo while also providing consistency and flexibility for the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a graveyard recursion strategy and powerful legendary creatures like Kethis, Lazav, and Jace, along with artifacts like Emry and Mox Amber to quickly fill the graveyard and cast spells from it. The combination of card draw, mana acceleration, and disruption from cards like Teferi and Oko allows for efficient combo setups and protection. The goal is to assemble the pieces necessary to win the game using Jace's ability to win when the library is empty, all while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 Aggro - Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells and creatures, allowing for the quick and efficient reanimation of Arclight Phoenix. Key cards such as Thing in the Ice and Fiery Temper help control the board while also enabling the graveyard synergies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast-paced plays and aggressive strategies, utilizing spells like Opt, Lightning Axe, and Izzet Charm to maintain card advantage and tempo. Treasure Cruise and Chart a Course provide additional card draw to keep the deck running smoothly.

This deck revolves around ramping up mana quickly through cards like Castle Garenbrig and Nissa's Pilgrimage, allowing for early plays of powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Emrakul, the Promised End. The inclusion of cards like Shrine of the Forsaken Gods and Hour of Promise also helps accelerate mana production for big plays. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim while also maintaining board control with cards like Walking Ballista and Blast Zone. This deck focuses on using green devotion and aggro strategies to dominate the battlefield.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cheap spells to bring back Arclight Phoenixes from the graveyard for repeated aggressive attacks. It includes a mix of card draw, burn spells, and cheap spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability. Saheeli, Sublime Artificer helps generate tokens and Nagging Thoughts allows for card selection. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and constantly applying pressure on the opponent, utilizing the Arclight Phoenix as a powerful recurring threat to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on creating an infinite combo by using Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to copy the Guardian and create an infinite number of hasty tokens attacking opponents. Other cards in the deck help to support and protect the combo, with cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns providing removal and disruption, while Teferi, Time Raveler allows for protection and consistency. The deck also includes ramp and card draw to help assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently, ensuring a strong and consistent win condition.

This deck focuses on creating infinite combos using cards like Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai to generate infinite copies of creatures or Planeswalkers. By leveraging these interactions, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful effects and board presence. The combination of control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and tempo plays with cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns helps the deck disrupt opponents' plans while executing its own win condition through the Copycat combo. Additionally, the deck utilizes ramp and efficient creatures to facilitate its game plan and ensure consistent execution of its combos.

The focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. By utilizing efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Eidolon of the Great Revel, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent on the back foot. The inclusion of cards like Light Up the Stage and Bomat Courier provides card advantage, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive stance while ensuring it doesn't run out of resources. Overall, the deck is all about speed, aggression, and consistency in dealing damage.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful combo with Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create infinite token copies of Felidar Guardian. Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect the combo by allowing it to be played at instant speed. Other cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Heart of Kiran provide additional support and flexibility. The deck also includes ramp creatures like Gilded Goose and Elvish Mystic to help accelerate the combo. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early and then win quickly with the combo.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize ramp cards such as Once Upon a Time, Nissa's Pilgrimage, and Explosive Vegetation to quickly build up mana and cast powerful green spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Dragonlord Atarka, Ulvenwald Hydra, and World Breaker while also generating devotion to green for added benefits. The inclusion of cards like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Shrine of the Forsaken Gods gives the deck additional late-game threats and ramp potential. Ultimately, the goal is to establish a dominant board presence and outpace the opponent with fast, aggressive plays.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost aggressive creatures such as Knight of the Ebon Legion and Bloodsoaked Champion, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Rider to clear the way for attacks. Thoughtseize allows for disruption of the opponent's game plan, while Smuggler's Copter provides card filtering and additional pressure. Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet provides resilience against graveyard strategies, while Phyrexian Revoker can shut down key opposing cards. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

This deck focuses on the interaction between Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create infinite copies of the Guardian, allowing for a loop that can generate infinite mana and infinite creature tokens. The deck also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Oko, Thief of Crowns to control the board and protect the combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes ramp cards like Llanowar Elves and Gilded Goose to accelerate the mana needed to set up the combo. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with creatures like Llanowar Elves and Sylvan Caryatid, while also utilizing Leyline of Abundance and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to generate even more mana. This allows the deck to play powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis ahead of schedule, overwhelming opponents with big creatures. The inclusion of blue planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns adds versatility and disruption to the aggressive game plan, making it a formidable force in the Pioneer format.

The main focus of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with low-cost, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage. The deck also takes advantage of burn spells like Lightning Strike and Wild Slash to remove opposing threats and close out the game. By combining efficient creatures with impactful spells, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on generating value through the interaction between Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create infinite copies of the Guardian. It also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Reflector Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to assemble the combo quickly while also utilizing cards like Oath of Nissa and Prime Speaker Vannifar to dig for key pieces. Additionally, the deck includes mana dorks like Gilded Goose and Elvish Mystic to accelerate its game plan. The mana base is designed to support multiple colors for the combo pieces.

This deck is focused on aggressive, fast-paced gameplay with a heavy emphasis on dealing damage quickly to the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler, Hazoret the Fervent, and Rampaging Ferocidon, along with removal spells like Dreadbore and Wild Slash, the goal is to constantly apply pressure and force the opponent to react. Smuggler's Copter and Heart of Kiran provide additional sources of damage while also helping with card draw and board presence. The deck's mana base is designed to support its strong red and black cards for a consistent and swift assault.

This deck focuses on creating infinite combo loops by using cards such as Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian. The goal is to generate an endless stream of tokens or triggers to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. The deck also includes strong control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently utilizing the copycat combo and powerful planeswalkers, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a fast-paced Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly playing and buffing creatures to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It includes powerful aggro cards like Pelt Collector, Ghor-Clan Rampager, and Experiment One to build a strong board presence early on. Additionally, cards like Atarka's Command and Embercleave provide additional damage and utility to finish off the opponent quickly. By utilizing efficient creatures and combat tricks, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize and mount a defense.
